channel.title: Networking on WyNotes
channel.description: Recent content in Networking on WyNotes

item.title: Networking Basics
item.description: IP Addresses IPv4 addresses are like 192.168.10.55 are decimal representations of binary form. They are composed of four binary blocks. Each block is 8 bits (or 1 byte), which specifies a number from 0 to 255.

item.title: DNS
item.description: Domain Name System (DNS) is the phone book of the internet. It translates human friendly domain names, e.g., www.exmaple.com, to computer friendly addresses like 192.

item.title: Ports
item.description: A port is an endpoint of communication; it’s the docking point where data flows through. Ports are a logical contrcut, but are commonly used in the TCP and UDP protocols.
